column1: '''Culumalda''' was a tree with hanging yellow blossoms that grew in [[Ithilien]], and especially in the woods around the [[Field of Cormallen]].<ref name=RC>{{HM
column2: RC}}, pp. 625-6 (citing from the [[Unfinished index]])</ref><ref name=SApp>{{S

column1: ''Culumalda'' was intended to be the source of the name ''[[Cormallen#Etymology
[[Helge Fauskanger]] has suggested that ''culumalda'' is [[Quenya]], consisting of ''[[kuluma
column2: culuma]]'' ("orange") + ''[[alda]]'' ("tree").<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], "[http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.rtf Quenya-English Wordlist (Quettaparma Quenyanna)]" at [http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion] (accessed 2 July 2011)</ref>
Tolkien]] indicated that the tree was "prob[ably] a [[Wikipedia:laburnum
